text: Thanks for stopping by for this week’s Style Scouting. My Sunday post where I share the random stuff that captured my attention or inspired me that I found online. I am writing this post hunkered down under 2 fur throws that are giving me warmth and comfort after coming down with a case of Covid. Ed got sick earlier in the week and said he felt like he did after we got the first Covid vaccine. He had one bad day, but soon was back at it never thinking he had Covid. Turns out he did and then I got it on Friday. No fun, but a mild case. I am literally looking at the bright side – out the sliding glass doors where a warm, sunny and sparkly 67 degree day lays ahead. I plan to go sit outside to breathe in the fresh air that will most definitely make me feel better. :-). Before I got sick, I did finish the area where we removed the kitchen cabinets. I will post the reveal this week. Now onto the inspiring links I found this week. Posts You May Have Missed This Week: Why decorating mistakes are a good thing. (open in same tab) Something to Think About Lie down, get comfy and tune into this free yoga nidra practice (open in same tab) 7 ways to be more creative than reactive. (open in same tab) “Winter is the time of promise because there is so little to do – or because you can now permit yourself the luxury of thinking so.” – Stanley Crawford If you enjoy these posts – You can find past Style Scouting posts here. And… If you’re catching up on blog posts you may have missed, be sure to sign-up to get my newest posts via email to stay up to date with everything that’s happening here on the blog and more. html:
Thanks for stopping by for this week’s Style Scouting. My Sunday post where I share the random stuff that captured my attention or inspired me that I found online.

I am writing this post hunkered down under 2 fur throws that are giving me warmth and comfort after coming down with a case of Covid. Ed got sick earlier in the week and said he felt like he did after we got the first Covid vaccine. He had one bad day, but soon was back at it never thinking he had Covid. Turns out he did and then I got it on Friday. No fun, but a mild case.

I am literally looking at the bright side – out the sliding glass doors where a warm, sunny and sparkly 67 degree day lays ahead. I plan to go sit outside to breathe in the fresh air that will most definitely make me feel better. :-).

Before I got sick, I did finish the area where we removed the kitchen cabinets. I will post the reveal this week.

Now onto the inspiring links I found this week.

Posts You May Have Missed This Week:

  • Why decorating mistakes are a good thing. (open in same tab)

Something to Think About


Lie down, get comfy and tune into this free yoga nidra practice (open in same tab)


7 ways to be more creative than reactive. (open in same tab)

“Winter is the time of promise because there is so little to do – or because you can now permit yourself the luxury of thinking so.” – Stanley Crawford

If you enjoy these posts – You can find past Style Scouting posts here.

And… If you’re catching up on blog posts you may have missed, be sure to sign-up to get my newest posts via email to stay up to date with everything that’s happening here on the blog and more.
